WorkItem.Description:
I get the following error when beginning step 2 of the tutorial (adding Store Manager Controller), "Unable to retrieve metadata for 'MvcMusicStore.Models.Album'. Using the same DbCompiledModel to create contexts against different types of database servers is not supported. Instead, create a separate DbCompiledModel for each type of server being used."

Doing a few quick searches it appears some issue related to Visual Studio 2012 and Microsoft SQL Server Compact 4.0.

Anyone know how to get this working?

Comments.Message:
Found a work around at:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12323307/error-when-creating-a-controller-in-visual-studio-2012

You can temporarily remove the connection string from your web.config file:

<add name="MusicStoreEntities" connectionString="DataSource=|DataDirectory|MvcMusicStore.sdf" providerName="System.Data.SqlServerCe.4.0"/>

save it, and then create the StoreManagerController with EF scaffolding.  It will then create the class and all of the views associated with it.  Then paste the connection string back into the web config file.  It worked!

So far, no issues.

Thanks, IT also works for some of my project, I was facing the same issue. Thanks 
:-)

The problem is that the connection string from the tutorial is missing the '/' in front of the sdf filename.

bad:
<add name="MusicStoreEntities"
         connectionString="Data Source=|DataDirectory|MvcMusicStore.sdf"
         providerName="System.Data.SqlServerCe.4.0"/>

good:
<add name="MusicStoreEntities"
         connectionString="Data Source=|DataDirectory|/MvcMusicStore.sdf"
         providerName="System.Data.SqlServerCe.4.0"/>

This might be easier to read....
The problem is that the connection string from the tutorial is missing the '/' in front of the sdf filename.

bad:
     <add name="MusicStoreEntities"
     connectionString="Data Source=|DataDirectory|MvcMusicStore.sdf"
     providerName="System.Data.SqlServerCe.4.0"/>
good:
     <add name="MusicStoreEntities"
     connectionString="Data Source=|DataDirectory|/MvcMusicStore.sdf"
     providerName="System.Data.SqlServerCe.4.0"/>
Commenting the MusicStoreEntities connection string in the web.config worked for me.

Commenting out the connection string worked for me.  

Adding the backslash between the `|DataDirectory|` and `MvcMusicStore.sdf` did not.
